data.sentence: The word هِيَ comes from the root ه ي and is associated with the meanings: she

data.meanings: to draw forth, take away, pluck out, bring out, snatch away, remove, strip off, tear off, extract, withdraw, draw out sharply, perform ones duty, yearn, depose high officials, resemble, draw with vigour, invite others to truth, rise, ascend, draw from the abode or bottom, carry off forcibly, deprive.
data.sentence: The word وَنَزَعَ comes from the root ن ز ع and is associated with the meanings: to draw forth, take away, pluck out, bring out, snatch away, remove, strip off, tear off, extract, withdraw, draw out sharply, perform ones duty, yearn, depose high officials, resemble, draw with vigour, invite others to truth, rise, ascend, draw from the abode or bottom, carry off forcibly, deprive.

data.meanings: to touch, aid, do good, be beneficent, show power and superiority, a hand. By his agency/means.With a willing hand, out of hand, having financial ability.In acknowledgement of the superior power, in ready money and not in the form of deferred payment, considering it as a favour, on account of help, (payment should be made by the hand of the parties themselves without the intervention of a third party and without reluctance.baina yadaihi - before him, in his presence hit, between his two hands.ulill aidi - men of power (lit. gifted with hands)suqaita fi aidihim (idiomatic expression) they repented, the idea seems to be that they hit their fingers in grief and contrition.Handy, Might, Power, Superiority, Benefit, Possession, Favour, Generosity. The idea behind those expressions is that the use of the hand is the real source of the superiority and power. Under his authority, upper hand, arm, foreleg of a beast, handle of a tool, wing of a bird.ma qaddamat yada - that is what thou hast deserved.
data.sentence: The word يَدَهُ comes from the root ي د ي and is associated with the meanings: to touch, aid, do good, be beneficent, show power and superiority, a hand. By his agency/means.With a willing hand, out of hand, having financial ability.In acknowledgement of the superior power, in ready money and not in the form of deferred payment, considering it as a favour, on account of help, (payment should be made by the hand of the parties themselves without the intervention of a third party and without reluctance.baina yadaihi - before him, in his presence hit, between his two hands.ulill aidi - men of power (lit. gifted with hands)suqaita fi aidihim (idiomatic expression) they repented, the idea seems to be that they hit their fingers in grief and contrition.Handy, Might, Power, Superiority, Benefit, Possession, Favour, Generosity. The idea behind those expressions is that the use of the hand is the real source of the superiority and power. Under his authority, upper hand, arm, foreleg of a beast, handle of a tool, wing of a bird.ma qaddamat yada - that is what thou hast deserved.

data.meanings: to see, look at, glance, gaze, observe, behold, consider, regard, listen to, be patient towards, wait, contemplate, grant respite, put off, scrutinise, show kindness, examine, search, reflect. nazara - the look with affection, to perplex, dazzle.
data.sentence: The word لِلنَّاظِرِينَ comes from the root ن ظ ر and is associated with the meanings: to see, look at, glance, gaze, observe, behold, consider, regard, listen to, be patient towards, wait, contemplate, grant respite, put off, scrutinise, show kindness, examine, search, reflect. nazara - the look with affection, to perplex, dazzle.
